result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:54 p.m.  7/15/22 inducement.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  8/26/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:01 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L. Springstube appeared by video.  Attorney Eric R Pangburn appeared by video for Christopher L. Springstube. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-15-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eric Pangburn is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 08-01-22.

3:00 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher L. Springstube appeared by video.  PFAC has been fled.  The Court reviews and will appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:07  pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Springstube appearing in person. More time needed to get counsel.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.

3:05 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher Springstube appearing by video.  Defendant does not qualify for Public defender or court appointed counsel. However, he left out some information on the PFAC forms regarding his wages being garnished that may change the Court's decision.  He is advised to complete the forms again with that information included.  Defendant states he will stop at the Clerk's office and pick up another set of forms.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Initial appearance on May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Denying Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
Defendant is found not indigent.

11:11 AM Defendant Christopher L. Springstube appeared in court, Attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant wants an attorney. The matter is reset.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance set for March 7, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Re:  Operate under influence (4th), on 11-26-21.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of operate under influence (4th).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 9:30 a.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
